comments:
Windows XP, MySQL 4.1.16, Eclipse 3.2.1, Dali 0.5

When I have a table with two foreign keys pointing to same table, "Generate Entities..." wizard throws an exception:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-02-13 16:01:05.594
!MESSAGE mismatched sizes: 2 vs. 1
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException: mismatched sizes: 2 vs. 1
	at org.eclipse.dali.db.ForeignKey.buildColumnPairs(ForeignKey.java:151)
	at org.eclipse.dali.db.ForeignKey.getColumnPairs(ForeignKey.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.dali.db.ForeignKey.columnPairs(ForeignKey.java:163)
	at org.eclipse.dali.db.ForeignKey.baseColumns(ForeignKey.java:73)
...



Table generation script for MySQL that reproduces an error is here:


-- -------------------------
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS person;
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS city;

CREATE TABLE city (
	id decimal(10,0) unsigned NOT NULL default '0',
	name varchar(255) NOT NULL,
	PRIMARY KEY (id)
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;

CREATE TABLE person (
	id decimal(10,0) unsigned NOT NULL default '0',
	city_id decimal(10,0) unsigned,
	birth_city_id decimal(10,0) unsigned,
	PRIMARY KEY (id),
	FOREIGN KEY (city_id) REFERENCES city(id)
	  ON DELETE RESTRICT
	  ON UPDATE RESTRICT,
	FOREIGN KEY (birth_city_id) REFERENCES city(id)
	  ON DELETE RESTRICT
	  ON UPDATE RESTRICT
) ENGINE=InnoDB DEFAULT CHARSET=utf8;
-- -----------------------

I believe there is nothing unusual with these tables, but wizard can't cope with them.

If you remove second (or first) FOREIGN KEY declaration from PERSON, entity wizard works just fine. But then, one referential integrity is lost.


Regards,
Ognjen
This would appear to be the same issue report in bug 159372.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 159372 ***
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
